channel.title: Stopping duplicate entries in MySQL database?
channel.description:
Is there a way to stop duplicate entries being made into a certain database/table?
[stopping something like this happening] [IMG]http://i41.tinypic.com/ynlw9.png[/img] [size=6pt](phpMyAdmin)[/size]
My server checks if the user is in the database or not before adding a new user to the database. Is there something I can do [b]web sided[/b] for this?

item.title: Stopping duplicate entries in MySQL database?
item.dc:creator: @sspoke sspoke
item.description:
@sspoke wrote:

run this query and your problem will be solved

ALTER TABLE players ADD CONSTRAINT PK_username UNIQUE(username)

Read full topic
item.source: Stopping duplicate entries in MySQL database?

item.title: Stopping duplicate entries in MySQL database?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

RSCShadow:

Your username column should be set as a unique index, but you should also do a simple check on register to prevent this. Your passwords should also be using bcrypt or PBKDF2 to store passwords, never store them as plaintext.

Thanks! I was storing passwords as plain text just for testing lol

Read full topic
item.source: Stopping duplicate entries in MySQL database?

item.title: Stopping duplicate entries in MySQL database?

@RSCShadow wrote:

Your username column should be set as a unique index, but you should also do a simple check on register to prevent this. Your passwords should also be using bcrypt or PBKDF2 to store passwords, never store them as plaintext.
